message: Edsger W. Dijkstra considered 'Go To Statement Harmful' in 1968, advocating for structured programming.
Goto can be useful for error cleanup patterns in C (and Zen C), mimicking 'defer' or 'finally' blocks.
In C, `arr[i]` is just `*(arr + i)`. Fun fact: `i[arr]` is also valid syntax!
Pointer arithmetic scales by the size of the type. `ptr + 1` increases the address by `sizeof(*ptr)` bytes.
Use `(x & (x - 1)) == 0` to check if an integer is a power of two.
XOR swap algorithm: `x ^= y; y ^= x; x ^= y;` swaps variables without a temporary (but optimized code is usually faster).
To understand recursion, you must first understand recursion.
Tail Call Optimization (TCO) allows some recursive calls to consume no additional stack space.
The ternary operator `?:` is the only operator in C that takes three operands.
With great power comes great responsibility. Inline assembly is compiler-specific and fragile.
The Halting Problem proves it is impossible to determine if an arbitrary program will eventually stop.
Macros are handled by the preprocessor, doing simple text replacement before compilation begins.
A `void*` is a generic pointer type. You cannot dereference it directly without casting.
Subtracting two pointers returns a `ptrdiff_t`, a signed integer type capable of holding the difference.
In C, `main` implicitly returns 0 if no return statement is found (C99+). Zen C follows suit.
printf format strings are a mini-language interpreted at runtime. Be careful with user input!
The `!!` idiom (double negation) is a standard way to normalize any non-zero value to exactly 1.
Duff's Device interleaves a switch statement with a do-while loop to unroll copy loops.
In C, `sizeof` is an operator, not a function. Parentheses are only required for type names.
Digraphs and Trigraphs were added for keyboards missing symbols. `\?\?=` is `#`, and `<:` is `[`.
Function designators convert to pointers automatically. `foo`, `&foo`, and `*foo` all resolve to the same address.
The comma operator evaluates operands left-to-right and returns the last. `x = (1, 2, 3)` sets x to 3.
Multi-character constants like 'ABCD' are valid C. Their integer value is implementation-defined.
Bit-fields allow packing struct members into specific bit widths. `int x : 3;` uses only 3 bits.
Array indexing is commutative: `5[arr]` is semantically identical to `arr[5]`.
The `restrict` keyword promises the compiler that a pointer is the only access to that memory.
A struct's size can be larger than the sum of its members due to alignment padding.
In C, `void*` arithmetic is a GCC extension (treating size as 1). Standard C forbids it.
The C standard guarantees that `NULL` equals `(void*)0`, but the bit pattern may not be all zeros.
`sizeof('a')` is 4 in C (int) but 1 in C++ (char). A subtle difference between the languages.
Static local variables are initialized only once, even if the function is called multiple times.
The `volatile` keyword prevents compiler optimizations on a variable, useful for hardware registers.
In C99+, Variable Length Arrays (VLAs) can have runtime-determined sizes. Use with caution!
The `_Alignof` operator (C11) returns the alignment requirement of a type.
Compound literals like `(int[]){1, 2, 3}` create anonymous arrays with automatic storage.
Designated initializers: `.field = val` lets you initialize struct fields out of order.
The `#` stringification operator in macros turns arguments into string literals.
The `##` token-pasting operator concatenates tokens in macro expansions.
Flexible array members: `int data[];` at struct end allows variable-size structs.
Anonymous structs/unions (C11) allow direct member access without field names.
`_Generic` (C11) provides compile-time type dispatch, like a simpler form of overloading.
The `register` keyword is a hint to the compiler, but modern compilers ignore it.
Integer promotion: `char` and `short` are promoted to `int` in expressions.
Signed integer overflow is undefined behavior in C. Use unsigned for wrap-around arithmetic.
The order of evaluation for function arguments is unspecified in C. Never rely on it!
In C, you can take the address of a label with `&&label` (GCC extension).
The `inline` keyword is only a suggestion. Compilers decide whether to actually inline.
`setjmp`/`longjmp` provide non-local jumps, but are dangerous and rarely needed.
The `#pragma once` directive is non-standard but widely supported for include guards.
A `char` can be signed or unsigned depending on the platform. Use `signed char` or `unsigned char` to be explicit.
The `const` keyword doesn't make data immutable - you can cast it away (but shouldn't).
C has no native boolean type before C99. `_Bool` was added in C99, `bool` via stdbool.h.
Empty parameter lists in C mean 'unspecified arguments', not 'no arguments'. Use `(void)` for none.
The `extern` keyword declares a variable without defining it, linking to another translation unit.
K&R style function definitions predate ANSI C and put parameter types after the parentheses.
The IOCCC (Obfuscated C Code Contest) showcases creative abuse of C syntax since 1984.
Dennis Ritchie developed C at Bell Labs between 1969-1973. It replaced B, which was typeless.
The name 'C' simply comes from being the successor to the B language.
Plan 9 C allows `structure.member` notation even if `member` is inside an anonymous inner struct. C11 finally adopted this!
In Plan 9 C, arrays of zero length `int data[0]` were valid long before C99 flexible array members.
Plan 9 C headers are 'idempotent' â€” they contain their own include guards, so you never see `#ifndef HEADER_H` boilerplate.
In Plan 9, the `nil` pointer is distinct from 0. Accessing `nil` causes a hardware trap, not just undefined behavior.
Ken Thompson, creator of B and C, also designed UTF-8 encoding on a placemat in a New Jersey diner.
C11 introduced `_Noreturn` to tell the compiler a function (like `exit`) will never return control to the caller.
A 'Sequence Point' is a juncture where all side effects of previous evaluations must be complete. Violation = UB.
VLAs were mandatory in C99, but made optional in C11 because they are hard to implement safely.
Pre-ANSI C (K&R) didn't have `void`. Functions returning nothing actually returned an undefined `int`.
Adjacent string literals are concatenated automatically. `"Hello " "World"` becomes `"Hello World"`.
The `auto` keyword exists in C! It declares automatic storage duration, but is almost never used since it's the default.
Bitwise operators have lower precedence than comparisons! `val & MASK == 0` is `val & (MASK == 0)`. Always parenthesize!
The 'as-if' rule allows compilers to transform code however they want, as long as observable behavior remains the same.
Tail Recursion Elimination (TRE) isn't guaranteed by the C standard, but most compilers do it at -O2.
GCC's `__builtin_expect` allows you to tell the branch predictor which path is more likely (the `likely()` macro).
